content.description: Figure 1 shows a short segment of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule.
content.question: Figure 1. A short segment of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule Which of the following statements is correct about the molecule shown in Figure 1 ?

choices.label: It is <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>R</mi><mi>N</mi><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> because of the relative direction of the two strands.
It is <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because of the number of different nucleotides found in the molecule.
It is <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because of the nature of the hydrogen bonds between guanine and cytosine.
It is <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because of the nucleotides present.

content.answer: It is <math alttext="D N A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because of the nucleotides present.

skill.text: 2.A: Describe characteristics of visual representations of biological concepts and processes.
